# Quarto Pub

## Publishing Steps

Assume I have a file called `demo-pub2.qmd` opened in Positron. To publish my `qmd` file to my QuartoPub account I follow these steps:

1) Go to the __Terminal__ tab.
    + Make sure your working directory contains the qmd file.
2) Type command: `quarto publish demo-pub2.qmd`
3) Choose provider [Quarto Pub]{.bold-hilit} and press return (enter)
4) Publish with default account (linked to my email address)
5) Optionally: you can change the name of the document
6) Press return (enter)

. . .

Once published, there will be an associated link (URL), something like:
<https://username.quarto.pub/demo-pub-2>


## Submission to bCourses

Submit the URL (link) of your published document to the corresponding assignment in bCourses.

See [Assignments tab > Quarto Publications > Pub2]{.bold-hilit}


# Problem Set 2

## Pset 2

Available in bCourses:

See [Assignments tab > Problem Sets > PS2]{.bold-hilit}

You'll find 2 files:

- `ps2.html`: instructions

- `ps2.qmd`: template file to write your answers

. . .

In case of trouble: Go to Files tab, folder `problem-sets`, folder `ps2`, and download the `qmd` file.

Sometimes Safari blocks or denies you access. If this is the case you may want to use another browser (e.g. Chrome).


## Pset 2 Submission

- Submit your `qmd` and `html` files to bCourses.
- Use assignment problem set __ps2__
- Submission deadline: Wednesday 2/4 by 6PM.
- Graded credit / no-credit
- Credit for evidence of earnest engagement (just don't submit a blank or empty template file)
